It is officially classified as a 2nd class airport.Sendai Airport Car Rental, Airport info ; retrieved 2012-1-22. ==History== In 1940, the Imperial Japanese Army built Sendai Airport. In 1943, it was reformed into Sendai Army Flight School. At the end of World War II, the United States Army took control of the airport and its operations. In 1956, Sendai Airport was returned to Japan. The airport is marked by the design of its terminal. The curving and waving roof imitates the mountainous landscape and undulating sea edge that surrounds it. "Contemporary Airport Design," Designboom; retrieved 2012-1-22. The building was finished in 1997. It was designed by Gyo Obata of Hellmuth, Obata + Kassabaum (HOK).Sendai Airport Passenger Terminal Building," International Architecture Yearbook, Issue 5 (April 29, 1999), pp. 136-137. According to HOK, the iconic form represents the aspirations of the region."Anthony Leslie Authors Article on Asia-Pacific Airports," Hellmuth, Obata + Kassabaum (HOK), 1 April 2009; retrieved 2012-1-22. ===2011 Tōhoku earthquake and tsunami=== During the 2011 Tōhoku earthquake, the airport was damaged by the tremors and it was flooded. A week later, military engineers opened the airport for disaster relief.
